comments:
Often, when I am just restarting Tomcat I get an error dialog that says an internal error occurred. This 
appears in the log:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 2005-03-21 22:46:41.881
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Publishing to Tomcat v5.0 Server @ localhost...".
!STACK 0
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1792960864
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerPublishInfo.getDelta(ServerPublishInfo.java:255)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerPublishInfo.getDelta(ServerPublishInfo.java:269)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerPublishInfo.getDelta(ServerPublishInfo.java:269)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerPublishInfo.getDelta(ServerPublishInfo.java:269)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.ServerPublishInfo.getDelta(ServerPublishInfo.java:240)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.getPublishedResourceDelta(Server.java:1019)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server$2.visit(Server.java:825)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.ServerUtil.visitModule(ServerUtil.java:484)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.ServerUtil.visit(ServerUtil.java:468)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.doPublish(Server.java:835)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.Server.publish(Server.java:797)
	at org.eclipse.wst.server.core.internal.PublishServerJob.run(PublishServerJob.java:52)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Hi Rob,

You are using the last milestone or an older build, correct? I've checked the 
code, and this problem was fixed several weeks ago. It should be ok when you 
move up to a new build.

This error happens to me as well.
WTP-Version: Last milestone, 1.0M3

It always happens, after removing a jar from a project's WEB-INF/lib directory 
on every subsequent server start.
After restart of the Eclipse IDE, the error doesn't appear anymore.
So obviously a problem with caching of the project's library lists.

chily
